channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - World
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2022 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Russian-linked forces 'tortured' and 'executed' civilians in Central African Republic since 2019, HRW says
item.description: Forces identified by witnesses as Russian have "summarily executed, tortured, and beaten civilians" in the Central African Republic (CAR) since 2019, a report by rights group Human Rights Watch (HRW) has alleged.

item.title: At least three killed in suspected terror attack in Israel
item.description: At least three people were killed and four injured in a suspected terror attack in the central Israeli city of Elad, according to Israel's emergency response services.

item.title: US assesses that North Korea may be ready to conduct underground nuclear test this month
item.description: US military and intelligence agencies assess that North Korea could be ready to resume underground nuclear testing this month, according to three US officials.

item.title: WHO: Third case of Ebola detected in DRC
item.description: Health authorities in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) have identified a third case of Ebola in the city of Mbandaka, the World Health Organization said Thursday.

item.title: Buffett says Berkshire's success is more about being 'sane' than 'smart'
item.description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has beaten the broader market so far this year. But the Oracle of Omaha wasn't willing to declare himself an investing genius during Saturday's annual shareholder meeting.

item.title: Electric car startups want to avoid same fate as Britain's 1890s bike bubble
item.description: Amazon and Ford reported this week they lost a combined $12.3 billion in the last three months due to their investments in electric vehicle company Rivian. The losses dampened hopes that any electric vehicle company will inevitably turn into gold.

item.title: The Fed's favorite inflation measure hit a fresh 40-year high
item.description: Americans had to reach deeper into their pockets in March, as yet another key inflation index showed prices hit a fresh 40-year high last month.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg just got $11.5 billion richer
item.description: Nearly two months after losing his spot among the world's 10 richest rich people, Mark Zuckerberg is clawing his way back.

item.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
item.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

item.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
item.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

item.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
item.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

item.title: The Met Gala's best style moment?
item.description: Blake Lively paid tribute to New York City architecture in a shimmering gown that dramatically transformed as she walked the Met Gala red carpet on Monday night.

item.title: These Met Gala looks paid homage to the marginalized people of the Gilded Age
item.description: The Met Gala returned to its typical first Monday in May date this week, and celebrities honored this year's theme of "gilded glamour" with cinched waists, trailing coattails and tulle aplenty.

item.title: Met Gala 2022: Best fashion from the red carpet
item.description: The Met Gala is fashion's big night out -- and celebrities are known for saving their most striking outfits for its often-theatrical red carpet.

item.title: The Met Gala accessory of the night
item.description: With a dress code honoring America's Gilded Age, the Met Gala's guests looked to the past for inspiration. And there was one accessory that stole the show Monday night: the vintage tiara.

item.title: Kim Kardashian wore one of Marilyn Monroe's most iconic dresses to the Met Gala
item.description: As the Met Gala red carpet drew to a close on Monday night, Kim Kardashian arrived fashionably late in a sparkling skin-tight gown once worn by Marilyn Monroe. Adorned with over 6,000 handsewn crystals, the pre-loved dress was worn by Monroe when she famously sang "Happy Birthday" to President John F. Kennedy in 1962.

item.title: This space hotel is due to open in 2025. Here's what it's like inside
item.description: Waking up in a chic hotel room with a view of the solar system could be the future of travel, at least if space company Orbital Assembly has anything to say about it.

item.title: 30 classic Italian dishes that everyone should try
Unusual airlines that really existed
item.description: In the late 1970s, the US government deregulated the airline industry, removing federal control over fares, routes and the entry of new airlines into the market.

item.title: Can the world's largest plane ever fly again?
item.description: The images of the wrecked Antonov AN-225 are now an indelible memory for aviation enthusiasts worldwide.

item.title: The summer of travel chaos just got more chaotic
item.description: Temperatures are rising, Covid cases are falling, restrictions are dropping away in the blink of an eye and summer vacations are so close you can smell the sunscreen. But getting away this year won't be easy or relaxing.

item.title: Sign up for our 9-part Italy travel and food newsletter
'She's my guardian angel': DoorDasher saves woman's life while delivering pizza
item.description: When a Massachusetts woman ordered a pizza on a routine Friday evening, she had no idea the quick thinking and kindness of her delivery driver would change her life that night.

item.title: A 'lawyer by day and a boot smuggler by night,' this Ukrainian American is helping funnel supplies to Ukrainian soldiers
item.description: Tetiana Poudel's father, a deputy commander in Ukraine's Territorial Defense Forces, needed combat boots.

item.title: Florida deputy climbs building to rescue a baby from an Orlando apartment fire
item.description: A Florida deputy climbed the outside of an apartment building to rescue a one-year-old girl from a fire early Saturday and the dramatic scene was captured on the deputy's body camera, officials said.

item.title: 0% intro APR until nearly 2024 is 100% insane
It's official: now avoid credit card interest into 2024
Experts: this is the best cash back card of 2022
Put your equity to work for you with a cash-out refinance
